message.entry: Could not load audioplayer object properly. {0} property was not set.
When creating an audioplayer object from an audio signal, all input arguments must be numeric.
Invalid number of bits per sample. Valid values are 8, 16, and 24.
Could not find the specified device
Input must be an audiorecorder object.
NBITS must be specified as a finite scalar value.
Currently only 8, 16, and 24-bit audio is supported.
ID must be specified as a finite scalar value.
Sample rate must be a positive number between {0,number,integer} and {1,number,integer}
SAMPLERATE must be specified as a finite scalar value.
Only one- and two-channel audio supported.
First input must be a numeric signal or audiorecorder object.
Y must be specified as a non-empty numeric input.
TimerPeriod must be >= 0.001 (one millisecond).
TAG must be a character vector or string scalar.
Unsupported data type.
Invalid function handle.
No audio outputs were found.
Unable to play audio.
Audioplayer objects cannot be concatenated.
The second argument to PLAY must be a numeric scalar or 2 element vector.
Invalid playback selection. Playback will start at the beginning.
This function is only for use with 32 bit Windows machines.
audiorecorder input is not supported for audioplayer in MATLAB Online.
Unable to create a connection with the audio output device.
Unable to change sample rate after object creation in MATLAB Online.
Timeout occurred while trying to communicate to the device.
BitsPerSample is ignored in MATLAB Online.
Audio device access is not supported in this browser. Use Google Chrome instead.
